titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER of Detention pending trial as to defendant Omar Marin. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)[8:07-mj-00084-TDT]

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER of Detention pending trial as to defendant Omar Marin. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)[8:07-mj-00084-TDT]

titleInfo.title: USA v. Marin
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion 17 for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture is hereby sustained. The United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement for the District of Nebraska is hereby authorized to seize the Hi Point 9mm Semi-Automatic Handgun with Winchester 9mmammunition. Defendant's interest in said property is hereby forfeited to the United States of America for disposition in accordance with the law. The aforementioned forfeited properties are to be held by ICE in its securecustody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C. ยง 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed, as to defendant Omar Marin (1). Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. Certified copy USM. (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion 17 for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture is hereby sustained. The United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement for the District of Nebraska is hereby authorized to seize the Hi Point 9mm Semi-Automatic Handgun with Winchester 9mmammunition. Defendant's interest in said property is hereby forfeited to the United States of America for disposition in accordance with the law. The aforementioned forfeited properties are to be held by ICE in its securecustody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C. ยง 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed, as to defendant Omar Marin (1). Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. Certified copy USM. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Marin
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Omar Marin (1), Defendant plead guilty to Counts II and III of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for 15 months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment; final order of forfeiture as to Count II forthcoming, Criminal Case Terminated as to defendant Omar Marin. Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (4 certified copies to USM)(CJP)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Omar Marin (1), Defendant plead guilty to Counts II and III of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for 15 months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment; final order of forfeiture as to Count II forthcoming, Criminal Case Terminated as to defendant Omar Marin. Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (4 certified copies to USM)(CJP)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Marin
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 26 Motion for Final Forfeiture as to Omar Marin (1). All right, title and interest in and to the Hi Point 9mm semi-automatic handgun, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The Hi Point 9mm semi-automatic handgun is forfeited to the U.S.A. The U.S. Marshals Service for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law. Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (1 Certified copy to USM) (JSF)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 26 Motion for Final Forfeiture as to Omar Marin (1). All right, title and interest in and to the Hi Point 9mm semi-automatic handgun, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The Hi Point 9mm semi-automatic handgun is forfeited to the U.S.A. The U.S. Marshals Service for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law. Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (1 Certified copy to USM) (JSF)
